response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<E> it = new DynamicIterator(da); it.hasNext(); ){
  System.out.println(it.next());
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new DynamicIterator(da) in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject: I have a JSONObject that contains a key called "name" and I want to get the value of that key. I tried using JSONObject.get("name") but it doesn't work.
Please using this api: JSONObject.get("name").
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.get("name")
<<<code>>>: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String name = jsonObject.getString("name");
<<<explanation>>>: You can use JSONObject.get(String key) to get the value of a key in a JSONObject.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONArray: I have a JSONArray that contains a key called "name" and I want to get the value of that key. I tried using JSONArray.get(0) but it doesn't work.
Please using this api: JSONArray.get(0).
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONArray.get(0)
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(jsonString);
String name = jsonArray.getString(0);
<<<explanation>>>: You can use JSONArray.get(int index) to get the value of a key in a JSONArray.
